sleep.description_core: for the 'scrape' and 'daemon' commands, the number of seconds chifra should sleep between runs (default 0)

fn_list.description_core: path(s) of files to check, merge, fix or display (default=display)

check.description_core: check for duplicates and other problems in the cache

data.description_core: in 'list' mode, render results as data (i.e export mode)

sort.description_core: sort the list of transactions and re-write (precludes other modes, other than --dedup)

fix.description_core: remove duplicates from the cache (if any)

list.description_core: list the contents of the cache (the default if no other option)

import.description_core: import transactions if import.txt file exists in current folder

remove.description_core: remove transactions if remove.txt file exists in current folder

truncate.description_core: truncate the cache at block :n (keeps block 'n' and before, implies --fix)

maxBlock.description_core: for testing, max block to visit

merge.description_core: merge two or more caches into a single cache

start.description_core: un-used hidden value - do not remove

no_header.description_core: do not show header row of data

logs.description_core: display smart contract lo(g)s or events

accounting.description_core: display credits and debits per account and reconcile at each block

no_check.description_core: do not do balance check at each block

debug.description_core: enter debug mode (pause after each transaction)

single.description_core: if debugging is enable, single step through transactions

export.description_core: export the transactions to export file

json.description_core: ignore export format and export as json

bals.description_core: if a balance does not reconcile, export a message to a file

version.description_core: display the current version of the tool

raw.description_core: report JSON data from the node with minimal processing

veryRaw.description_core: report JSON data from node with zero processing

to_file.description_core: write the results to a temporary file and return the filename

output.description_core: write the results to file 'fn' and return the filename

file.description_core: specify multiple sets of command line options in a file.

staging.description_core: produce results in the staging folder instead of production folder

unripe.description_core: visit unripe (not old enough and not yet staged or finalized) blocks

daemon.description_core: we are being called in daemon mode which causes us to print results differently

no_header.description_core: do not show the header row

start.description_core: start block for scan of appearances

list.description_core: Index transactions for a given Ethereum address (or series of addresses).

version.description_core: display the current version of the tool

raw.description_core: report JSON data from the node with minimal processing

veryRaw.description_core: report JSON data from node with zero processing

to_file.description_core: write the results to a temporary file and return the filename

output.description_core: write the results to file 'fn' and return the filename

file.description_core: specify multiple sets of command line options in a file.

addr_list.description_core: one or more addresses (0x...) to export

articulate.description_core: articulate transactions, traces, logs, and outputs

logs.description_core: export logs instead of transaction list

traces.description_core: export traces instead of transaction list

balances.description_core: export balance history instead of transaction list

count_only.description_core: display only the count of the number of data items requested

blocks.description_core: write blocks to the binary cache ('off' by default)

writeTxs.description_core: write transactions to the binary cache ('on' by default)

writeTraces.description_core: write traces to the binary cache ('on' by default)

ddos.description_core: skip over dDos transactions in export ('on' by default)

maxTraces.description_core: if --ddos:on, the number of traces defining a dDos (default = 250)

no_header.description_core: do not show the header row

allABIs.description_core: load all previously cached abi files

grabABIs.description_core: using each trace's 'to' address, grab the abi for that address (improves articulation)

freshen.description_core: freshen but do not print the exported data

deltas.description_core: for --balances option only, export only changes in balances

export.description_core: Export full detail of transactions for one or more Ethereum addresses.

version.description_core: display the current version of the tool

raw.description_core: report JSON data from the node with minimal processing

veryRaw.description_core: report JSON data from node with zero processing

to_file.description_core: write the results to a temporary file and return the filename

output.description_core: write the results to file 'fn' and return the filename

file.description_core: specify multiple sets of command line options in a file.

addr_list.description_core: one or more addresses to slurp

block_list.description_core: an optional range of blocks to slurp

silent.description_core: Run silently (only freshen the data, do not display it)

slurp.description_core: Fetches data from EtherScan for an arbitrary address. Formats the output to your specification.

version.description_core: display the current version of the tool

raw.description_core: report JSON data from the node with minimal processing

veryRaw.description_core: report JSON data from node with zero processing

to_file.description_core: write the results to a temporary file and return the filename

output.description_core: write the results to file 'fn' and return the filename

file.description_core: specify multiple sets of command line options in a file.

term_list.description_core: a space separated list of one or more search terms

expand.description_core: expand search to include all fields (default searches name, address, and symbol only)

owned.description_core: Include personal accounts in the search

named.description_core: Include well know token and airdrop addresses in the search

addr.description_core: display only addresses in the results (useful for scripting)

accounts.description_core: Query addresses and/or names of well known accounts.\n

version.description_core: display the current version of the tool

raw.description_core: report JSON data from the node with minimal processing

veryRaw.description_core: report JSON data from node with zero processing

to_file.description_core: write the results to a temporary file and return the filename

output.description_core: write the results to file 'fn' and return the filename

file.description_core: specify multiple sets of command line options in a file.

addr_list.description_core: list of one or more smart contracts whose ABI to grab from EtherScan

canonical.description_core: convert all types to their canonical represenation and remove all spaces from display

generate.description_core: generate C++ code into the current folder for all functions and events found in the ABI

encode.description_core: generate the encodings for the functions / events in the ABI

json.description_core: print the ABI to the screen as json

noconst.description_core: generate encodings for non-constant functions and events only (always true when generating)

sol.description_core: create the ABI file from a .sol file in the local directory

open.description_core: open the ABI file for editing, download if not already present

silent.description_core: if ABI cannot be acquired, fail silently (useful for scripting)

abi.description_core: Fetches the ABI for a smart contract. Optionally generates C++ source code representing that ABI.

version.description_core: display the current version of the tool

raw.description_core: report JSON data from the node with minimal processing

veryRaw.description_core: report JSON data from node with zero processing

to_file.description_core: write the results to a temporary file and return the filename

output.description_core: write the results to file 'fn' and return the filename

file.description_core: specify multiple sets of command line options in a file.

addr_list.description_core: one or more addresses (0x...) from which to retrieve balances

block_list.description_core: an optional list of one or more blocks at which to report balances, defaults to 'latest'

mode.description_core: control which state to export. One of [none|some*|all|balance|nonce|code|storage|deployed|accttype]

nozero.description_core: suppress the display of zero balance accounts

changes.description_core: only report a balance when it changes from one block to the next

no_header.description_core: hide the header in txt and csv mode

no_history.description_core: for testing only, hide the server's historical state

state.description_core: Retrieve the balance (in wei) for one or more addresses at the given block(s).

version.description_core: display the current version of the tool

raw.description_core: report JSON data from the node with minimal processing

veryRaw.description_core: report JSON data from node with zero processing

to_file.description_core: write the results to a temporary file and return the filename

output.description_core: write the results to file 'fn' and return the filename

file.description_core: specify multiple sets of command line options in a file.

block_list.description_core: a space-separated list of one or more blocks to retrieve

hash_only.description_core: display only transaction hashes, default is to display full transaction detail

check.description_core: compare results between qblocks and Ethereum node, report differences, if any

addrs.description_core: display all addresses included in the block

uniq.description_core: display only uniq addresses found per block

uniqTx.description_core: display only uniq addresses found per transaction

filter.description_core: useful only for --addrs or --uniq, only display this address in results

latest.description_core: display the latest blocks at both the node and the cache

force.description_core: force a re-write of the block to the cache

quiet.description_core: do not print results to screen, used for speed testing and data checking

source.description_core: either :c(a)che or :(r)aw, source for data retrival. (shortcuts -k = qblocks, -r = node)

fields.description_core: either :(a)ll, (m)ini, (c)ache or :(r)aw; which fields to include in output (all is default)

normalize.description_core: normalize (remove un-common fields and sort) for comparison with other results (testing)

blocks.description_core: Returns block(s) from local cache or directly from a running node.

block_list.description_core: an optional list of one or more blocks at which to report balances, defaults to 'latest'

byAcct.description_core: consider each address an ERC20 token except the last, whose balance is reported for each token

nozero.description_core: suppress the display of zero balance accounts

eab.description_core: pull the enhanced adaptive blooms from QBlocks cache

block.description_core: show only the block-level bloom (--raw only)

receipts.description_core: show only the receipt-level blooms (--raw only)

bits.description_core: display blooms as bits instead of hex

bars.description_core: display blooms as bar chart instead of hex

bitbars.description_core: display nBits as a bar chart

pctbars.description_core: display nBits as a percentage of bloom space

bitcount.description_core: display the number of bits lit per bloom

force.description_core: force a re-write of the bloom to the cache
